Voter fraud has been confirmed in several states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's top election official is warning residents about a potential scam to obtain sensitive information from potential voters after similar concerns in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration assistance organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone and in some cases send the voter an absentee ballot, said Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. According to state law, residents cannot register to vote or request an absentee ballot over the phone.

For small businesses that sell on credit, accounts receivable can constitute a substantial portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, auditors will verify if their assertions regarding the accounts receivable balance can be proven. These assertions are known as assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, in which the auditor will ask their clients to confirm their account balance. Knowing which assertions can be proven by confirmation can help you understand why your auditor requests multiple audit procedures on the same account. Accounts receivable confirmations primarily serve to prove the existence assertion.

It happens: you press the snooze button once, twice, and then three times, so that when you've finally showered, dressed, and are ready to face the day, you're already running behind schedule. Many times, that makes you skip breakfast altogether. It turns out that your breakfast habit is a time-saving measure that shouldn't be skipped. Firstly, eating a nutritious, high-protein, and balanced breakfast every morning is a proven way to give your brain a boost, improving concentration and performance. Additionally, breakfast is associated with better weight control, as it provides energy to your body and can reduce hunger later in the day.

Dublin: Lawmakers voted overwhelmingly on Friday to back Ireland's first abortion bill, legalizing the practice in exceptional cases where doctors deem a woman's life at risk due to her pregnancy, as the predominantly Catholic country took its first legislative step away from a total ban. Exhausted lawmakers applauded the 127-31 Friday vote, while outside the gates of parliament, pro-abortion rights activists cheered as they watched the result on their smartphones. It brought an end to an exhausting debate that kept lawmakers in discussion from Wednesday morning until 5am on Thursday and, after a sleep break, until midnight on Friday.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to collapse under the intense heat of Volgograd when they face Nigeria in only their second World Cup match on Friday, after having impressively drawn with two-time champions Argentina over the weekend. World Cup debutants Iceland, are dreaming of the knockout stage and are writing a new chapter in one of the most notable stories in international football in recent years. Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules that prohibit abusive behavior on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet threatened that North Korea might "not be around much longer", Twitter was forced to explain why the president wasn't kicked off the service. In a six-part tweet from Twitter's public policy account, the company said that Twitter takes into account "newsworthiness" and "public interest" when determining whether a user has violated its rules. These considerations have long been used internally when deciding the fate of a problematic user, Twitter said.

After basically following the pace for the first two months of the year, Summit County real estate sales experienced a downturn in March, leading to a notable drop in the county's first-quarter figures, according to Slifer Smith & Frampton. ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror is lurking among the residents of Pata Island in Sulu and it does not come from extremists, but from politicians. The residents sought help from the government to prevent another attack on their island community, which according to one of them, was provoked by the residents' refusal to provide support to the incumbent mayor, Anton Burahan. "We are powerless," said 60-year-old Bidin Jubail, a resident of Saimbangon, one of the villages on Pata Island. Jubail recalled an attack on the island on January 2, allegedly by Burahan's followers, who were armed with an M203 grenade launcher, and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

German business confidence plummeted in October to its lowest level in more than 2 and a half years, the sixth consecutive decline that dispels any lingering doubt that Europe's largest economy is now mired in the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo think tank said on Wednesday that its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of around 7,000 companies, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The clouds over the German economy are darkening," said Ifo President Hans-Werner Sinn. The euro hit a one-week low against the dollar and European stocks turned negative after the Ifo announcement.

LOS ANGELES – A proposal to grant subpoena power to the oversight commission that monitors the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department will go to a vote in March 2020, after failing to be adopted by the Board of Supervisors today. Supporters of the "Los Angeles Jail Reform Initiative" gathered nearly a quarter of a million signatures in support of the measure, which would also give the Civilian Oversight Commission a mandate to study reducing the county's jail population and reallocating dollars from jail construction to alternatives to incarceration. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl said that more than the county's more than 10 million residents should be allowed to participate in the vote.

OTTAWA, March 20 (Reuters) - In a new blow to the embattled government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, a legislator left his ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent on Wednesday after defending a former minister at the center of a political scandal. Trudeau has been on the defensive since February 7 over accusations that top officials working for him pressured former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure that construction company SNC-Lavalin Group Inc would avoid a corruption trial. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of being re-elected in a vote scheduled for October this year.

The Iranian Foreign Minister, Javad Zarif, met with Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the Prime Minister's House, where both sides emphasized the need to promote bilateral relations in all areas of cooperation. Without a doubt, the addiction drama "Beautiful Boy" – and not the horror movie "Halloween" – is the scariest movie opening in the multiplex this weekend. Starring Steve Carell ("Foxcatcher") and Timothée Chalamet ("Call Me by Your Name"), the film is a chilling and disturbing look at a young man's fall into methamphetamine addiction (and heroin, pills, marijuana, etc.) and the efforts of a devoted father to save him. HARRISBURG, Pennsylvania -- The Office of the Auditor General of Pennsylvania announced that it is releasing more than $55 million in funds for thousands of volunteer fire departments. Officials say the money will be distributed based on population and the number of volunteer fire departments. Excluding Philadelphia, all 66 remaining counties in the state will receive money. That includes at least $57,000 for each county in northeastern and central Pennsylvania. Luzerne County will receive the largest amount: $1.1 million. Volunteers from the Lake Silkworth Fire Department are dispatched at all hours of the day across the mountain in back of Luzerne County.

Brazil is currently implementing the Brazil Without Misery program — a continuation of the successful Zero Hunger — which aims to do precisely that, says Marques Porto. Initiated in 2003 by former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, Zero Hunger is credited with having lifted 30 to 40 million Brazilians out of poverty. One of the program's main actions was to provide poor children with free school lunches, which were purchased by the state from family farms. In this way, support was provided to local small farmers while offering quality nutrition to children from low-income families.

The data center market in Russia continues to grow, just look at the considerable increase in commissioned facilities to find evidence of this. Consumers are no longer impressed by data centers spanning several thousand square meters, containing 1000 or more racks, as these have become commonplace. According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, over the last two years, the Russian data center market is ahead of India, China, and Brazil in terms of total investment. Similarly, according to recent construction data from the same period, Russia ranks second only to Brazil among BRICS nations in terms of total area.

GENEVA – The head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the conflict in Gaza, Judge Richard Goldstone, today urged the international community to put an end to impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territory, as he presented the Mission's report* to the Human Rights Council. Following its three-month investigation, the four-person Mission concluded that serious violations of international human rights and humanitarian law were committed by Israel in the context of its military operations in Gaza from 27 December 2008 to 18 January 2009, and that Israel committed actions that amount to war crimes, and possibly crimes against humanity.

John Tory has his first real competition in the mayoral race. Jennifer Keesmaat, the city's former planning director, registered on Friday before the 2 p.m. deadline to run for mayor. Oden Technologies, an emerging startup that aims to make factories smarter through big data and its Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) platform, has raised $10 million in a Series A funding round led by Atomico, with participation from EQT Ventures, Inbox Capital, and a number of other seed investors. Founded in London in 2014, Oden Technologies provides the hardware and software that enables manufacturers to access analytics to track failures and establish patterns that can impact performance. Ultimately, it's about improving efficiency and reducing production waste.
